title: 107_s1042
content: The Act titled "Filipino Veterans' Benefits Improvements Act of 2001" establishes the rate of payment for certain benefits for new Philippine Scouts residing in the United States. Section 107 of title 38, United States Code, is amended to redesignate provisions and adjust the rate of payment for benefits. Subsection (c) is designated as subsection (d), and subsection (b) is modified to include exceptions in payments. The amendments made by subsection (b) of the Act will take effect on the date of enactment and apply to benefits paid for months starting from that date. SEC. 3 amends the rate of payment for dependency and indemnity compensation for surviving spouses of certain Filipino veterans under title 38, United States Code. The effective date is upon enactment and applies to benefits paid from that date. SEC. 4 addresses the eligibility of certain Filipino veterans for disability pension. Section 107 of title 38, United States Code is amended to adjust eligibility requirements and rate of payment for certain benefits. Amendments include changes to subsections (a) and (b) regarding specific chapters and sections within the title. The amendments made to Section 107 of title 38, United States Code include adjustments to eligibility requirements and payment rates for benefits under chapter 15. Benefits paid to individuals in the United States or the Republic of the Philippines will have specific conditions applied. The amendments will be effective upon the enactment of the Act and will apply to benefits starting from that date. SEC. 5 amends section 1734 of title 38, providing health care for Filipino veterans in the United States. SEC. 6 addresses outpatient health care for veterans in the Philippines. Section 1735 of title 38, United States Code, provides outpatient care and services for World War II veterans residing in the Philippines. The Secretary is required to furnish care for service-connected and nonservice-connected disabilities at the Manila VA Outpatient Clinic, with a yearly expenditure limit of $500,000. The Secretary is authorized to provide outpatient care and services for World War II veterans in the Philippines, with a yearly expenditure limit of $500,000. The availability of appropriations determines the extent of care provided. Outpatient care and services for World War II veterans in the Philippines will be provided with a yearly expenditure limit of $500,000. The amendments made by this section will take effect on the date of the enactment of this Act.
